CADI.Server.Core

Class TasksQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • CADI.Server.Core.TasksQueue

  • public class TasksQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a queue where the works to be done by a thread are saved by the Scheduler.

    NOTICE: Implementing of different kinds of priorities is very easy. Using several queues with differents priorities and then doing the necessary changes in the add and get methods.

    Usage example:
      construct
      add
      get

    Version:
    1.0 2007-2012/10/26
    Author:
    Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(TasksQueueNode nodeInfo)
      Adds new work to the queue, and it notifies it to the dispatcher requests.
      TasksQueueNode get()
      Returns the first element of the queue if it isn't empty, otherwise null.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the list is empty, false otherwise
      void list(java.io.PrintStream out)
      Prints this Tasks Queue fields out to the specified output stream.

      Returns the size of the queue.

    • Field Detail

      • queue

        private java.util.ArrayList<TasksQueueNode> queue
        Contains a list of works. The ArrayList is not a synchronized data list, so the class methods implement the concurrence to avoid simultaneous access.

    • Constructor Detail

        Constructor of RequestQueue. It initializes the queue of sets to a void queue.
